text: Robert Heiner Garff (September 15, 1942 â€“ March 29, 2020) was an American businessman and politician. He was chair of the Ken Garff Automotive Group. He was a member of the Utah House of Representatives from 1978 to 1987, where from 1985 to 1987 he was Spekaer. Garff was a member of the Republican Party. He was chairman of the Salt Lake Organizing Committee for the 2002 Winter Olympics. He was born in Salt Lake City, Utah. Garff died of COVID-19 in Salt Lake City on March 29, 2020 at the age of 77. ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in the United States Category:State legislators of the United States Category:Politicians from Salt Lake City, Utah Category:Businesspeople from Salt Lake City, Utah Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
title: Robert H. Garff
